data.title: Louise Hires a Contract Killer
data.text:

Benoît DelépineWritten byGustave de Kervern

Release date

Running time

94 minutesCountryFranceLanguageFrenchBudget$2.2 million [1]Box office$5 million [2]

Louise Hires a Contract Killer (French: Louise-Michel) is a 2008 French comedy film written and directed by Gustave de Kervern and Benoît Delépine. The film won the Prix Jacques Prévert du Scénario for Best Original Screenplay in 2009.

Cast

[edit]

Yolande Moreau as Louise Ferrand

Bouli Lanners as Michel Pinchon

Benoît Poelvoorde as Guy

Albert Dupontel as Miro

Miss Ming as Jennifer

Catherine Hosmalin as Madame Pinchon

Francis Kuntz as Frambard

Philippe Katerine as The singer

Gustave Kervern as The ship's captain

Critical reception

[edit]

The film was well received by the critics. Review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes reports that 81% of 16 critics gave the film a positive review, for an average rating of 6.4/10. [3]
